In order to enforce the bug appearance one could used tensorflow.contrib.learn in TF 1.8 and Google Datalab as shown here

The log from this training is here

body:
In order to enforce the bug appearance one could used **tensorflow.contrib.learn** in TF 1.8 and Google Datalab as shown [here](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1yF1XwCN8J0tHPOB1IFYMDTXX1kITBE0Y)

The log from this training is [here](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1rZ72r5VQQJqbOFQcqOYRT7hEM09lL0sX)  

selected rows with loss value:

> Line 39: INFO:tensorflow:loss = 0.44986597, step = 1
	Line 140: INFO:tensorflow:Saving dict for global step 1: global_step = 1, loss = 0.44986597
	Line 141: INFO:tensorflow:Validation (step 94): loss = 0.44986597, global_step = 1
	Line 152: INFO:tensorflow:loss = 67.273926, step = 101 (28.679 sec)
	Line 256: INFO:tensorflow:loss = 18.575909, step = 201 (24.346 sec)
	Line 362: INFO:tensorflow:loss = 1.3139261, step = 301 (30.483 sec)
	Line 468: INFO:tensorflow:loss = 0.608429, step = 401 (29.466 sec)
	Line 574: INFO:tensorflow:loss = 1.2948558, step = 501 (27.934 sec)
	Line 680: INFO:tensorflow:loss = 1.8674694, step = 601 (27.611 sec)
	Line 784: INFO:tensorflow:loss = 86.05044, step = 701 (23.794 sec)
	Line 888: INFO:tensorflow:loss = 63.37451, step = 801 (28.128 sec)
	Line 994: INFO:tensorflow:loss = 2.190352, step = 901 (34.924 sec)
	Line 1042: INFO:tensorflow:Saving dict for global step 937: global_step = 937, loss = 0.38724956

Behavior of  the loss function is clearly different!
